newsitem.title: UZBEKISTAN: Tashkent airport sees modernisation starting 1997.
newsitem.headline: Tashkent airport sees modernisation starting 1997.

text.p: The airport in Uzbekistan's capital will begin a modernisation project in 1997 using Western loans, a senior official said on Tuesday.
Khairulla Abdulayev, director of Uzbek airport construction, told Reuters the European Bank of Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) had agreed to lend $13 million towards the project.

Abdulayev said a tender would be announced next year to reconstruct the airport's passenger terminal. The project, which is being developed by British Aerospace would cost $35 million and would also be funded by the EBRD, he said.
"After 18 months' modernisation the airport will increase its passenger turnover and air safety standards will reach ICAO (International Civil Aviation Organisation) levels," he said.
Earlier this year German firms modernised runways at the airport. Work cost 53.9 million marks which covered by a loan.
